alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 24 at 9:33AM CDT until May 28 at 8:01AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair zone. ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada... flooding is possible. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 4.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM CDT.
